abstracts.cdata!:
This report pertains to the components
            of the First Petroleum Sector Project in the former
            Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (SFRY) that were
            located in the Autonomous Province of Vojvodina. It is
            impossible to rate the project since some activities have
            not been completed because of the sanctions imposed on
            Yugoslavia by the United Nations Security Council. The
            project components in Vojvodina were financed separately by
            a loan in the amount of US$35.0 million. Of this amount,
            US$2.6 million was cancelled in 1992 while US$32.4 million
            had been disbursed. After mid-1991, some project components
            became progressively delayed due to hostilities between the
            Federal Republic of Yugoslavia and the Republic of Croatia
            so that not all the objectives of the project were reached.
            The composition of the project remained very much as
            designed at appraisal. All amendments prompted by technical
            reasons were made in full agreement between the Bank and the
            Borrower. However, contacts with the Borrower became
            sporadic after 1990 as a result of sanctions. Following the
            United Nations sanctions against Yugoslavia, the
            Borrower's special project account was blocked,
            delaying final payments for essential material.

abstracts.cdata!:
The First Petroleum Sector Project Loan
            for the former Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia that
            were located in the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, was
            approved by the Board on June 27, 1985 and became effective
            on August 15, 1986. At appraisal, project implementation was
            scheduled to be completed by December 31,1990. This was
            delayed until December 1991 by late effectiveness of the
            loan, delays in contracting consultants during the early
            part of the project and from mid 1991 onwards, hostilities
            near and in the project area. Of the loan amount of 2.5
            million US dollars a total of 1,523,481 US dollars was
            cancelled. Loan was closed on June 30, 1992 at which time
            976,518 US dollars had been disbursed.

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project supports a cross
            section of the hydrocarbon exploration and production
            activities in the Socialist Republics of Croatia and
            Bosnia-Herzegovina and in the Socialist Autonomous Province
            of Vojvodina. Its objective is to assist in the development
            of indigenous energy resources, thereby reducing
            Yugoslavia's dependence on imported energy. The project
            comprises support for a time slice of the gas exploration
            programs for INA-Naftaplin, Nafta-Gas and EXPL through: (i)
            the expansion of exploration activities to the more complex
            and deeper areas that hold the potential for increasing the
            country's future recoverable reserves of hydrocarbons;
            (ii) the acceleration of exploration activity in Yugoslavia
            by promoting to international petroleum companies
            exploration areas that are prospective but are
            insufficiently explored due to the inadequate resources of
            the local companies; (iii) the strengthening of the
            technical capabilities of Yugoslav petroleum companies to
            develop gas reserves under high pressure and temperature,
            and containing corrosive gases; and (iv) the introduction of
            an underground gas storage system to reduce problems related
            to seasonal demand for gas.
